678965.name: Twiddlemuff
678965.notes_html:
A Twiddlemuff is a double thickness hand muff with bits and bobs attached inside and out. It is designed to provide a stimulation activity for restless hands for patients suffering from dementia. Knit for Peace will distribute these via NHS Hospitals in the UK and the patient then gets to take them home with them so there is always demand for more.

Written for DK and Chunky weight yarn.
678965.notes:
A Twiddlemuff is a double thickness hand muff with bits and bobs attached inside and out. It is designed to provide a stimulation activity for restless hands for patients suffering from dementia. Knit for Peace will distribute these via NHS Hospitals in the UK and the patient then gets to take them home with them so there is always demand for more.

Written for DK and Chunky weight yarn.

users.about_me:
Knit for Peace is based on an observation that knitting provides benefits both to the knitter and the recipient. Knit for Peace started by encouraging women and men from different, often historically hostile, communities to come together informally to knit. Based on our experience of developing Knit for Peace over the last few years, we have learned that knitting is extremely important as an activity that can be carried out right into extreme old age and helps improve long-term health. As well as encouraging everyone to knit, we receive daily donations of hand-knitted clothes from knitters all over the UK. We never sell the clothes, we send them to where they are needed. We send out tens of thousands of items a year, giving to a diverse range of services, such as refugee centres, homeless shelters, and hospitals.

For more information please visit our website at

[http://knitforpeace.org.uk/][1]


  [1]: http://www.knitforpeace.org.uk

857250.name: TinkerBall- Sensory Plush Toy
857250.notes_html:
Pattern includes instructions for 3 sizes

16” Large (Bigger than a softball)
13” Small (Size of softball)
11” Mini (Size of baseball)

The TinkerBall ™ is a crocheted ball of happiness.
The toys main purpose it to bring calmness to those who suffer with anxiety and stress.
For all ages ~ Males & Females~ Even Pets
Helps with ADD/ADHD, Self Soothing, Hand Eye Coordination with toddlers, Anxiety disorders, Autism Spectrum disorder, Alzheimer’s disease, Dementia and just common day stress.

users.about_me: I'm a creator at heart.  I use all mediums.  I do a number of crafts.  Knitting and crocheting are my "while watching TV" activity.  Started RJK Crochet about a year ago.  Invented the Self-Soothing stress ball called the TinkerBall.  Working on developing crocheted stuffed animals.  The line will be Keddy's Bears.  I only use soft yarn.  Mostly Bernat Blanket, Caron Simply Soft, and Premier Parfait.

Mostly Bernat Blanket, Caron Simply Soft, and Premier Parfait.

977309.name: Fidget Sleeve
977309.gauge_description: 19 stitches and 26 rows = 4 inches in stocking stitch
977309.notes_html:
This fidget glove was designed for a relative with dementia. It is offered to you for free, but please consider making a small charitable donation to Cure Alzheimer’s Fund.

Uses small quantities of 5 different colors of worsted or arun-weight yarn. Embroider french knots and add colorful beads, buttons, ribbons or pom-poms.

Update: Some people have expressed concern about adding beads, buttons and ribbons because they could be a choking hazard. Please make sure they are securely fastened. You might consider knitting them right into your work.

Or try what Hanksmom did and knit bobbles and/or use fun fur yarn, to give your sleeve an interesting texture. I am amazed at all the wacky and wonderful variations people have come up with!

998270.name: Juniper the Jellyfish
998270.sizes_available: One size. Length from top of head to bottom of tentacles: 14” (35.5 cm)
998270.notes_html:
Juniper the Jellyfish is a fun amigurumi project that your little one is sure to love! You can make this jellyfish (with sewn eyes instead of plastic safety eyes) to comfort a preemie, NICU baby, or newborn infant, as crochet toys with coils remind babies of the umbilical cord, which can help calm them. Articles have reported evidence that they can calm baby’s breathing, regulate baby’s heartbeat, and give baby strong oxygen blood levels. This jellyfish can also serve as a fun play toy for children, as décor in a kids room, or as part of a mobile in a sea-themed nursery!

This handmade gift is perfect for birthdays, baby showers, craft fairs, and more! Easily customize your jellyfish by using different colors and adding embellishments!

~~~

Size:
Head only: 2.5” (6.5 cm) in height, 11” (28 cm) in circumference.
Length from top of head to bottom of tentacles: 14” (35.5 cm)

Level:
★★☆☆☆ Easy / Familiar Beginner
Requires familiarity with stitches used (below), attaching yarn, attaching safety eyes, and sewing parts together.

Stitches/Terms (US Terms):
• MR: magic ring
• Ch: chain
• Sl st: slip stitch
• Sc: single crochet
• Hdc: half dc
• Dc: double crochet
• Inc: increase
• Dec: decrease

Materials:
• Medium weight 4 yarn in desired colors (Note: I used pink, orange, yellow)
• 2.75 mm crochet hook
• 4.00 mm crochet hook
• 10mm plastic safety eyes
• Fiberfill stuffing
• Yarn needle
• Scissors

~~~

This pattern is © 2020 Sweet Softies (www.sweetsofties.com). For personal use only. You may not copy, alter, or sell this pattern in any way. You may sell finished items made with this pattern if you credit Sweet Softies as the designer and link to my website. No wholesale.*

www.sweetsofties.com
www.instagram.com/SweetSofties (@SweetSofties)
www.etsy.com/shop/Sylemn
www.facebook.com/SweetSofties
www.youtube.com/SweetSofties
www.pinterest.com/sweetsofties

1015020.name: Twiddle Muff
1015020.notes_html:
These muffs are in high demand for dementia patients as well as some special needs children. They are used for sensory stimulation and seem to help calm the people who use them.

Lots of different things can be added to the muffs for stimulation - pony beads can be knitted in, fabric ribbons can be used, bath puffs can be sewn on, little items like stress balls, can be sewn on after the muff is made. Look for things in the kid’s section of stores. Be careful with what you add though, because anything with sharp edges can tear fragile skin. Items like metal nuts and screws from the hardware store are not really appropriate for these. Also, sometimes the plastic beads have very rough edges too. Be aware that sometimes people put things like this in their mouths, so be sure that anything you do sew on is secure.

To add texture to the muff, consider using a furry or fuzzy yarn as one of the strands as you knit. Even small amounts of a novelty yarn add lots of texture to these.

Please consider donating items made from this pattern to your local Alzheimer Association, area Assisted Living units, or Assisted living centers for dementia patients. They are in great need of these.

Look for things in the kid's section of stores. Be careful with what you add though, because anything with sharp edges can tear fragile skin. Items like metal nuts and screws from the hardware store are not really appropriate for these.  Also, sometimes the plastic beads have very rough edges too. Be aware that sometimes people put things like this in their mouths, so be sure that anything you do sew on is secure. 

To add texture to the muff, consider using a furry or fuzzy yarn as one of the strands as you knit. Even small amounts of a novelty yarn add lots of texture to these.

packs.yarn_name: Hobby Lobby I Love This Yarn! Solids

1125773.name: Twiddle Muff
1125773.notes_html:
Twiddle Muffs help people with issues resulting from conditions such as Dementia, Alzheimer’s, ADHD, or anxiety by providing a comforting sensory experience. Patients will redirect their fidgeting to the muff, instead of picking on clothing buttons, healing wounds, or even their IV.

Bright colors and a variety of textures are ideal for your Twiddle Muff, and this useful item can also keep hands warm. The pattern is more of an improvisational recipe than a rigid set of directions.

Once completed, Twiddle Muffs can be dropped off at Makers’ Mercantile, and we would be honored to handle the distribution to those who can use them.

Follow us on Instagram to never miss a stitch!

Bright colors and a variety of textures are ideal for your Twiddle Muff, and this useful item can also keep hands warm. The pattern is more of an improvisational recipe than a rigid set of directions.

Once completed, Twiddle Muffs can be dropped off at [Makers’ Mercantile][1], and we would be honored to handle the distribution to those who can use them.

> Follow us on [Instagram][2] to never
> miss a stitch!

users.about_me: I live and breathe knitting.  My life is crazy busy with ,carpooling, & knitting every spare moment. I currently am working at Maker's Mercantile in Kent, Wa.!!!

1161500.name: Fidget Sensory Muff
1161500.notes_html:
link text Fidget Sensor Muffs can be used to calm anxiety for patients suffering from Alzheimer’s or Dementia, keeping their hands snug and warm

Materials needed:
Worsted weight yarn
6.5 mm crochet hook
Tapestry needle
Scissors

One skein of Red heart super saver yarn makes 3 to 4 Fidget sensory Muffs

YouTube tutorial here https://youtu.be/uqnz7ntZIsI

1183338.name: Spiralling Square
1183338.yarn_weight_description: Any gauge - designed for any gauge
1183338.notes_html:
Crochet mobius fidget toy in the shape of a two-layer square.

Your purchase is greatly appreciated, but if you need a free copy of the ebook for charity projects, feel free to use coupon code “CharityFidgets01”.

The edge of the toy can be endlessly pulled out from the center as a tool for focusing attention or calming restless nerves. Makes a great stashbuster, gift, or charity project. The geometric shape takes a bit more counting than other crochet mobius fidgets, but is still very simple.

Can be made in any desired gauge. Example uses worsted weight (#4 Medium) yarn and size I (5.5mm) crochet hook.

Materials;
Any desired yarn
Matching crochet hook
Stitch Marker
Scissors
Yarn needle

Stitches used:
ch - chain
sc - single crochet
sl st - slip stitch

Many thanks to Penny, Donna, and Lois of Lake Area Fiber Arts Guild - https://www.lakefiberarts.com/
And to the designers behind the following tutorials:
Lisa of less-waste.co.uk: “Hyperbolic Mobius” - https://www.less-waste.co.uk/yarn-scrap-hyperbolic-mobius/
Maak het met Miranda - Made with Miranda Workshops at Youtube: “Miranda’s Magic Fidget” - https://youtu.be/w4uzQqsrjrI

Designer’s Note: You may sell items you make from this pattern or do whatever else you like with them. You may also use this pattern to teach classes and distribute copies to the students. Otherwise, please do not redistribute the pattern itself; please link to the source.

Lisa of less-waste.co.uk: “Hyperbolic Mobius” - [https://www.less-waste.co.uk/yarn-scrap-hyperbolic-mobius/][2]
Maak het met Miranda - Made with Miranda Workshops at Youtube: “Miranda’s Magic Fidget” - [https://youtu.be/w4uzQqsrjrI][3]

Designer’s Note: You may sell items you make from this pattern or do whatever else you like with them. You may also use this pattern to teach classes and distribute copies to the students. Otherwise, please do not redistribute the pattern itself; please link to the source.

1183345.name: Neverending Nonagon
1183345.yarn_weight_description: Any gauge - designed for any gauge
1183345.notes_html:
Crochet mobius fidget toy in the shape of a two-layer nonagon.

Your purchase is greatly appreciated, but if you need a free copy of the ebook for charity projects, feel free to use coupon code “CharityFidgets01”.

The edge of the toy can be endlessly pulled out from the center as a tool for focusing attention or calming restless nerves. Makes a great stashbuster, gift, or charity project. The geometric shape takes a bit more counting than other crochet mobius fidgets, but is still very simple.

Can be made in any desired gauge. Example uses worsted weight (#4 Medium) yarn and size I (5.5mm) crochet hook.

Materials;
Any desired yarn
Matching crochet hook
Stitch Marker
Scissors
Yarn needle

Stitches used:
ch - chain
sc - single crochet
sl st - slip stitch

Many thanks to Penny, Donna, and Lois of Lake Area Fiber Arts Guild - https://www.lakefiberarts.com/
And to the designers behind the following tutorials:
Lisa of less-waste.co.uk: “Hyperbolic Mobius” - https://www.less-waste.co.uk/yarn-scrap-hyperbolic-mobius/
Maak het met Miranda - Made with Miranda Workshops at Youtube: “Miranda’s Magic Fidget” - https://youtu.be/w4uzQqsrjrI

Designer’s Note: You may sell items you make from this pattern or do whatever else you like with them. You may also use this pattern to teach classes and distribute copies to the students. Otherwise, please do not redistribute the pattern itself; please link to the source.

1348143.name: Fidget Hexaflexagon
1348143.notes_html:
Do you want to distract your child and enjoy your favorite cup of coffee in silence? Or do you like to spin something in your hand to concentrate better? The anti-stress spinner in the form of hexaflexagon will become your faithful companion in any stressful situation! This educational toy will also help to develop your child’s spatial thinking, help to learn colors and train fine motor skills. Children love to spin this toy!
A cute, light and interesting toy that is addictive! A great souvenir gift for a child, daughter, son, granddaughter, grandson, teenager or even an adult.
With this pattern you can easily create this toy yourself!

For this crochet pattern I used YarnArt Jeans and Alize Cotton Gold yarns. The Flexagon is 15 cm in size, but you can use any yarn you like (you will need to choose the hook size for your yarn yourself), and the size of the toy will probably be different.
To create a toy, you will also need a filler (I use holofiber), a needle and scissors.

If you use the yarn indicated in the pattern, you will need about 25-30 grams of yarn of 5 colors (you can choose any color).
The pattern does not contain crochet lessons.You will need basic crochet skills.
The pattern is filled with a lot of photos that will help you assemble the toy in the correct sequence.

If you have any questions, I will be happy to help you solve them!

Buy the Hexaflexagon pattern and fill your world with bright and interesting entertainment!

1350429.name: Marble Fidget Toy
1350429.notes_html:
Another free little pattern for some fun stim toys! These have a marble in them you push around and it’s just a really nice feeling. They’re also no-noise stims so you can use it anywhere without worrying about being too noisy.

This is my own design and I’m sure there’s others out there, but I included some guide photos as well as just fun little options in it. Standard gauge isn’t necessary just make sure it’s even enough when you’re done or block it/pull it to be more even while you’re stitching it together.

Thank you for taking the time to look and to possibly use this! :smiley:

users.about_me: I'm 29 and I crocheted way back in elementary for a year or so, dropped it til last sept of 2022, and I've been a fiend since. Feels good on my brain to make the yarn go knot knot.

1355209.name: Sensory Caterpillar
1355209.gauge_description: 20 stitches and 26 rows = 4 inches in stockinette
1355209.notes_html:
Adorable knitted sensory caterpillar toy is a perfect baby gift for all to admire at everyone’s baby shower. Worked in the round, from tail to the head in one piece. The legs and antennas are knit separately and sewn together with a small amount of face embroidery. Optional is to knit each body part separately and sewn together.
Finished Toy Size: 30.5” (78 cm) long from tail to head.

Suggested Yarn: KnitPicks Dishie, Worsted Weight (100% Cotton; 190 yards/100 g); 1 skein each: Mulberry 25784 – C1, Eggplant 27039 – C2, Blue 25787 – C3, Jade 29503 – C4, Bumblebee 28096 – C5, Clementine 25403 – C6, Fiesta Red 25786 – C7, Swan 25409 – C8, Black 26669 – C9.

Yardage: C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, C6, C7: 30 – 40 yards / 27 – 37 meters each; C8, C9: 10 yards / 9 meters each.
1355209.notes:

pattern_author.name: Stana D. Sortor
pattern_author.notes:
*Stana D. Sortor’s grandmother taught her how to knit and crochet when she was a little girl. Ever since she took her projects everywhere. Of course she has experienced some sidesteps on her knitting path, like trying to be an artist, photographer or writer, but she always returned to her favorite activity.*

Would you like to see what am I am up to and get some exclusive coupons and savings? Sign up for my newsletter:

[Stana's Critters Etc][1]

Or you can follow me on: 
[Stana's Critters etc on Instagram][2]
[Stana's Critters Etc blog][3]
Or join our friendly Ravelry group [Stana's Critters Etc][4]
Or follow me on FB [Stana's Critters Etc][5]

Some of my patterns are for sale and plenty are free. The patterns for sale are helping me to support my creativity and share it with you.
You can also purchase the pattern in  
[my Etsy store][6], [on Payhip][7], or you can buy me a coffee to show your appreciation of my free patterns.

[Stana's Critters Etc on Ko-Fi][8]

Thank you for stopping by. 

I hope you will have fun when knitting some of my creations!


  [1]: https://stanascrittersetc.com/
  [2]: https://www.instagram.com/stanascrittersetc/
  [3]: http://stana-critters-etc.blogspot.com/
  [4]: https://www.ravelry.com/groups/stanas-critters-etc
  [5]: https://www.facebook.com/Stanascrittersetc/
  [6]: https://www.etsy.com/shop/Stanascrittersetc?ref=ss_profile
  [7]: https://payhip.com/StanasCrittersEtc
  [8]: https://ko-fi.com/stanascrittersetc

users.about_me:
My maternal grandmother taught me to knit and crochet when I was a little girl. At first I preferred crochet, but then I knitted my first sweater when I was 14 and I haven't stopped. 
Over the years knitting become an important part of my life. I use the needles the way painters use their paint brush. 
I prefer to create rather than write about it. However, after many years of attending University as an adult student I have finally reached the goal, and I have earned BA in English, Creative Writing. 
English is not my native tongue, so I am very happy to reach such an achievement. 

Thank you for stopping by.

I have created a group for my knitted creations, please come visit. http://www.ravelry.com/groups/stanas-critters-etc

Have fun knitting some of my creations!

1358825.name: Fidget Leaves Earrings
1358825.notes_html:
These fidget leaves will help you focus or relax! I had this idea while on my way home from work. I realized I would love some fidget jewelry and could make some myself!

Video tutorial coming soon.
1358825.notes:
These fidget leaves will help you focus or relax! I had this idea while on my way home from work. I realized I would love some fidget jewelry and could make some myself! 

Video tutorial coming soon.

1363533.name: Fidget Shrooms
1363533.notes_html:
Fidget Shrooms! You can:
Pull it,
Twist it,
Pop it,
Push it,
And smush it!
These are therapeutic toys for those who are Neurodivergent. I myself was diagnosed with ADHD at 12 and know what its like to need something to do with my hands to focus and stay calm.
This is a perfect gift for ADHD/Autistic children, and adults.

Pattern can be done in under an hour and doe not require a lot of yarn. Multiple sizes can be made by using bigger yarn, doubling or tripling stranding the yarn, and using a bigger hook to make the pattern bigger, or using thinner yarn and a smaller hook to make the pattern smaller.
1363533.notes:

packs.yarn_name: Hobby Lobby I Love This Yarn! Solids

7402186.name: Tonya T-Rex
7402186.notes_html:
Tonya the T-Rex Sensory Snuggler is part stuffed animal, part squishable blankie, with sensory elements.

The sensory elements in the pattern include:

  1. Crinkly body and tail
  2. A variety of different texture stitches on the body
  3. A rattle in one hand
  4. A teether in the other hand

Links to the toy/sensory elements of this snuggler have been included in the written pattern. Please feel free to use other types of rattles, baby teethers, etc. to customize your toy!

Video tutorial for embroidered eyes is also including by following a YouTube link. Embroidered eyes are recommended as this pattern is designed for small children.

Materials Suggested Include:
1. Bernat Blanket/Bernat Baby Blanket or similar size 6 super bulky yarn in 4 colors

  • ~105 yards in main color
  • ~30 yards in accent color
  • Small amounts of black and white to embroider the eyes
  1. Scissors
  2. Stitch markers
  3. Finishing needle
  4. Polyfil stuffing
  5. Size 6.5mm crochet hook
  6. Crinkle Paper
  7. Baby chain links
  8. 2 teethers, rattles etc.
7402186.notes:

2. Scissors

4. Finishing needle
5. Polyfil stuffing
6. Size 6.5mm crochet hook
7. Crinkle Paper
8. Baby chain links
9. 2 teethers, rattles etc.

7403547.name: Worry Monster
7403547.sizes_available: Monster is about 18cm tall and 7cm wide
7403547.gauge_description: 22 stitches and 28 rows = 4 inches in Over Stocking stitch on 4.0mm needles
7403547.notes_html:
Don’t be a worry wart, brighten up your life and live care free with an easy to knit worry monster who will gobble up all of your worries and cares so you don’t have to worry about them any more.

The mouth is a little pocket. Write your worry on a scrap of paper and feed it to the monster.

The monster is knitted on 4mm needles and knits up in about an hour and a half. Monster is about 18cm tall and 7cm wide.

Great for stash busting, he can be knitted in any colour you have to hand, he could even be knitted in stripes!

Cute and fun, and brilliant for helping children to let go of their worries.

This monster was designed for Swindon Big Knit.

Watch the video of the Worry Monster on YouTube https://youtube.com/shorts/k8dT9pByWYA

Terms of use:
You are welcome to sell items made from my pdf patterns. I ask that you include a note about the item being a ‘TeaCosyFolk Design’ on the tag at a craft fair or in the description if you are selling online.

This pattern is not to be resold, loaned, photocopied, scanned, uploaded to any website, transferred on to CD, or transmitted to a third party.

Copyright TeaCosyFolk 2025
All rights reserved.

All patterns and photographs © www.teacosyfolk.co.uk

Need help? Join the TeaCosyFolk Knitting Pattern Help Group on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/groups/1125856847485631/

TeaCosyFolk is on Youtube #TeaCosyFolk
https://bit.ly/3sW0xFd

users.about_me:
I learnt to knit as a child. My grandmother lived in Rotherham and she didn't have a television, so when we went to stay with her, she used to teach us different crafts. I have always loved all crafts, so loved being taught new skills, and soon picked up knitting, crocheting, sewing, quilting and many other popular crafts.

As I grew up I crafted for fun and made things for myself and for gifts, but my knitting skills really improved when I had children. I would change patterns for children and babies clothing to create one off jumpers, cardies and baby blankets.

It wasn't until my thirties that I started designing tea cosies.

I had got caught up in the tea party fashion of the time when I bought a beautiful bone china cup and saucer set from a local bazaar. I loved inviting my friends around for tea and cakes and a good natter. Of course when your cups are only small, it’s essential to keep the teapot hot to keep the second cup of heat as hot as the first, and so I knitted myself a couple of tea cosies for the job. I had looked around on the internet and not found a tea cosy that I liked enough to knit. They were a bit old fashioned and all a bit samey. I designed and knitted the Robin tea cosy and the Bluetit tea cosy, (which are available to buy on my website). I thought I’d better knit two, one for wearing and one for washing; I’m always very practical.

My friends loved the tea cosies and asked me to make them one of the other of the two birds. And that got me thinking… Not to make tea cosies for sale, because although I love knitting, I don’t get much pleasure in knitting the same thing more than half a dozen times. (I find many people are the same) But it did make me think that maybe other people would get pleasure in knitting my tea cosies from my knitting patterns.

I wanted to create tea cosies that were unusual and unique. Tea cosies that spoke about peoples personalities, tea cosies that were talking points that related to their owners, and that’s when TeaCosyFolk was born. TeaCosyFolk are brilliant tea cosy designs with bags of character that keep the teapot piping hot, whilst echoing the tea makers personality and creating a great talking point at tea time, and even a chuckle.

![TeaCosyFolk][1]


  [1]: https://www.teacosyfolk.co.uk/images/logo/v4/teacosyfolk-logo-v4-480s.jpg
